dimensional.name: daylight plane
dimensional.description: Angle or plane to preserve daylight access

usage.name: incidental use
usage.description: Use must be incidental to main dwelling

numerical_values.description: Threshold for requiring a building permit
Threshold for allowing no more than two plumbing fixtures

specs: Count toward the total lot coverage
standards: Subject to accessory-structure height and daylight plane regulations

mandatory: Must have a use that is incidental to main dwelling
Must be detached and at least 3' from main dwelling
Count toward the total lot coverage

result: Count towards total gross floor area
May have no more than two plumbing fixtures

explicit_deviations: Accessory structures less than 120 sf do not require a building permit but must still comply with all zoning regulations

hierarchical: Accessory structures located in the buildable area are subject to the same height and daylight plane regulations as the main dwelling
cross_references: See Figs 25-26 on p. 32 for accessory-structure height and daylight plane regulations

extracted_rules.rule: Accessory structures located in the required setback

usage.name: prohibited uses
usage.description: May not be used for sleeping or living

numerical_values.description: Maximum coverage of the rear yard

specs: May not be located in the front yard
May not be located in the street-side yard
May not be located in the rear yard of a through lot
Count toward the total lot coverage
standards: Subject to accessory-structure height and daylight plane regulations

mandatory: May not cover more than 50% of the rear yard
May not be used for sleeping or living
Count toward the total lot coverage

result: Count towards total gross floor area
May have no more than two plumbing fixtures

explicit_deviations: Accessory structures less than 120 sf do not require a building permit but must still comply with all zoning regulations

cross_references: See Figs 25-26 on p. 32 for accessory-structure height and daylight plane regulations
